pages.text: The #mario games are always filled with bright and colorful elements. Over the years, many of those elements dwelled in the long grids called "levels". As you might know, #smm2 is a celebration of that aspect, and so is #mubble.<++>Customize your world and create #mario levels using the large collection of terrain and special blocks.

pages.title: What you'll need
pages.text: The <b>timeswap table</> will come in handy when manipulating blocks of this kind. Using this powerful tool, you will be able to <hl2>change the theme and style</> of any <hl1>maker block</>!

pages.title: ? Blocks
pages.text: This iconic block can be looted by <hl2>triggering</> it! (<i>jump right under it or input a redstone signal</>)<+>Depending on what style it is, the loots will change. For example, only the #nsmbu <b>? block</> will drop <hl1>super crowns</>. And only the #smw one will drop <hl1>cape feathers</>. It will turn into an <hl1>empty block</> afterwards.

pages.title: Ground Blocks
pages.text: As simple as it sounds, build the floor of your levels by mainly using this block and its very large amount of variants. With <hl3>ground</>, <hl3>underground</>, <hl3>underwater</>, <hl3>ghost house</>, <hl3>airship</>, <hl3>castle</>, <hl3>desert</>, <hl3>forest</>, <hl3>snow</> and <hl3>sky</> themes for every style, you surely won't have the time to try everything!

pages.title: Brick Blocks
pages.text: <b>Brick blocks</> work in a similar way as <hl1>? blocks</>, but won't always loot stuff. In fact, it has 1 chance on 2 to just break upon getting <hl2>triggered</>. If you're lucky, it might drop a few <hl1>yellow coins</>, or even <hl1>red ones</>!<+>There was no <b>brick block</> in #smw? No need to worry, we've created it!

pages.title: Golden Brick Blocks
pages.text: Just like <hl1>regular brick blocks</>, these <b>golden variants</> can drop coins! However, it will always drop <hl1>coins</>, and will never get destroyed when <hl2>activated</>. You will get much richer with those, since it has more chance to drop amounts of <hl1>coins</> that are more valuable than those that come out of <hl1>regular brick blocks</>.

pages.title: Rotating Blocks
pages.text: <b>Rotating blocks</> can be activated in the same manners as the previously seen blocks, and it will always break upon its activation. You can also <hl2>crouch-jump</> on it to <hl2>trigger</> it.<+>Out of the 4 styles, these blocks only appeared in #smw, but we've also added variants for #smb and #smb3, as well as #nsmbu.

pages.title: Light Block
pages.text: This cute little buddy will just emit light whenever you need it to, handy just like in the games.<++>Nothing special here.<+>It's just adorable.

pages.title: Hard Blocks
pages.text: Usually, <b>hard blocks</> are used by the #smm2 community to mark places where a path is <hl2>blocked</>, or can be exploded. However, since most of the blocks can be exploded in #minecraft, you may use them in another, yet creative, way!<+>They're pretty to look at though, so decorative motives work too.

pages.title: Ice Blocks
pages.text: The same can apply to <b>ice blocks</>. For this one though, there is a way to destroy it with a property that no other block has: throwing <hl1>fireballs</> at it will instantly melt it, leaving nothing but air behind. #minecraft's ice can also be melted by <hl1>fireballs</>, but this one leaves water after its death.

pages.title: Note Blocks
pages.text: Bounce up, and really high up into the air with the <b>note blocks</>! Walking upon them will <hl2>launch</> you up precisely 4 blocks into the air.<+><hl2>Crouch</>, and you will only rebounduce around 0.5 blocks high.

pages.title: Super Note Blocks
pages.text: This is the <b>super variant</> of the <hl1>note block</>. It is much stronger (<i>when you're not crouching</>), launching you at 10.5 blocks high.<+>Impressive!

pages.title: Doors
pages.text: These <b>doors</> work exactly as normal, #minecraft doors. (<i>except for the sounds</>)<++>Nothing else.<+>Use them as you want, they will work as you can already imagine.

pages.title: Key Doors
pages.text: <i>These</> <b>doors</>, however, won't open or close to $(t:right clicks or redstone signals)anything</> until $(t:with a right click)you <hl2>unlock</> them with the $(t:matching = from the same style)matching <hl1>key</>.
